channel.title: 2 questions
channel.description:
i was woundering if there was a code to make a certain item owner only..
and if there's a way to make it so more than 1 npc can attk you example:there's 3 rock crabs all three of them are attking you not just 1 thanks

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

I have pi. Just go to ItemAssistant.java and look for

the scroll a bit until you see this:

under the closing bracket “}” for that, add this:

if(wearID == XXXX && c.playerRights != 4){ c.sendMessage("Only the owner can wield this."); return false; }

Should be it.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @ipwnunoobs ipwnunoobs
item.description:
@ipwnunoobs wrote:

if (c.itemId == XXXX) { if (c.playerRights == 4) { c.equipItem(XXXX); } else { c.sendMessage("You can't equip this item because you are not the owner."); } }
try that…otherwise i failed in converting plox.

Read full topic

What I posted was a rough description of what it should look like. You’re going to have to put it in the right location, change the variable names, and add any code that you need.

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“war of godzz, post:1, topic:393810”]i was woundering if there was a code to make a certain item owner only…

and if there’s a way to make it so more than 1 npc can attk you
example:there’s 3 rock crabs all three of them are attking you not just 1
thanks[/quote]

For the owner only, you could probably just do something like

if (itemId == XXXX) {
    if (playerRights == 4) {
        equipItem(XXXX);
    }
    else {
        sendMessage("You can't equip this item because you are not the owner.");
    }
}

Although, if you want the item to be owner only, no one else should even be able to see it or pick it up.

Read full topic
